name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the frequency of the symbol k in the lexicographically earliest minimal superpermutation on n symbols, where the symbols are {1, 2, ..., n}.
comment: Equivalently, T(n,k) is the frequency of k in row n of A332089 (see there for more information).
link: Michael Engen and Vincent Vatter, Containing All Permutations, The American Mathematical Monthly, 128 (1), 2021, pp. 4-24 (preprint version).
example: For n = 3, the minimal superpermutation is 123121321; symbol 1 appears 4 times, symbol 2 appears 3 times and symbol 3 appears 2 times.
xref: Cf. A180632 (row sums, for n >= 1), A332089.
author: _Paolo Xausa_, Sep 28 2024
